results.firPara: • Captain to adopt midfield role alongside Dele Alli in attacking lineup
results.secPara: Wayne Rooney believes experience has changed his game for the better as the England captain prepares to venture into uncharted territory with the national side by taking on a midfield brief in the opening Group B fixture against Russia.
results.webTitle: Wayne Rooney sees benefit of moving backwards to go forward with England

results.firPara: • Wales must be prepared to win ugly in Euro 2016 opener, says manager
results.secPara: • Wales must be prepared to win ugly in Euro 2016 opener, says manager
results.webTitle: Chris Coleman urges Wales to be ruthless and horrible against Slovakia

results.firPara: José Mourinho sent Paddy McNair a good luck text for the European Championship and may have received a brusque reply but for an alert from Manchester United, the Northern Ireland international has disclosed.
results.secPara: The new United manager has contacted all the clubs players involved in France including McNair, who is in contention to start Northern Irelands first tournament game in 30 years on Sunday against Poland. The 21-year-old made only four starts under Louis van Gaal last season, having made 14 in the previous campaign, and is determined to impress the Dutchmans successor at the European Championship. But their relationship may have got off to an unfortunate start had McNair, who suspected Mourinhos message was a hoax, not read a warning sent by United.
results.webTitle: Euro 2016: Northern Ireland’s Paddy McNair hopes to impress José Mourinho

results.firPara: Northern Ireland make their first appearance at a European Championship on Sunday – 30 years to the day since losing 3-0 against Brazil in their last outing at a major tournament, the 1986 World Cup. A momentous occasion in the countrys football history will carry added significance for Jonny and Corry Evans. The former Manchester United graduates, now playing for West Bromwich Albion and Blackburn Rovers respectively, are the 17th pair of brothers to have been selected for a European Championship squad and the first to represent Northern Ireland at an international championship. Danny and Jackie Blanchflower would have featured in the 1958 World Cup for Northern Ireland but for the Munich air disaster earlier that year, which left Jackie with serious and ultimately career-ending injuries. Before the encounter with Poland in Nice, the Evans brothers discuss the revival instigated by the manager, Michael ONeill, and the debt they owe their parents, Dawn and Jackie.
results.secPara: Were you aware of making history for Northern Ireland when selected in the final 23-man squad?
results.webTitle: Northern Ireland’s Jonny and Corry Evans on being brothers at Euro 2016

results.firPara: The Real Madrid player is Welsh through and through but insists he does not feel pressure, as Slovakia and then England await, despite the weight of expectation that comes with his status as the teams talisman at Euro 2016
results.secPara: The Real Madrid player is Welsh through and through but insists he does not feel pressure, as Slovakia and then England await, despite the weight of expectation that comes with his status as the teams talisman at Euro 2016
results.webTitle: Gareth Bale on Wales: ‘We have a lot more pride and passion than England’

results.firPara: When Dimitri Payets number went up, the enormity of what he had just done hit him with the force of a wrecking ball. Frances Euro 2016 curtain-raiser looked set to end in frustration and, possibly, recriminations but with one sumptuous swing of his left boot Payet changed the complexion of the evening.
results.secPara: With the 90 minutes almost up, and Romania looking value for a draw, the West Ham United forward picked up possession outside the area, jinked inside and let fly. The shot flew unerringly into the far, top corner and the championship had its lift-off moment.
results.webTitle: Dimitri Payet’s stunner rescues France’s welcome party against Romania

results.firPara: Mission accomplished by France, who blended slickness and jitters throughout but were uplifted at the last by Payet, their best player on the night and the scorer of a superb winning goal. Thats a nice start for the hosts to build on, even if plenty of improvement will be needed for them to win here on July 10.
results.secPara: 90+3 min Matuidi releases Sissoko. He could announce his arrival in stye here ... but instead blasts a 20-yard shot wide.
results.webTitle: France 2-1 Romania: Euro 2016 opening game – as it happened

results.firPara: David de Gea has denied any involvement in a sexual assault case after the Manchester United goalkeeper was named by a protected witness as the person who arranged and paid for an encounter between two Spain Under-21 players and two women in a Madrid hotel in 2012. I am surprised by this, he said on Friday. I deny it, and thats it. Its a lie, false.
results.secPara: According to a report published by the website ElDiario.es on Friday, which includes copies of statements from two protected witnesses, a woman alleges that she was forced to have sexual relations with a new girl and two footballers, one of whom is named as the Athletic Bilbao forward Iker Muniain while the other has not been identified but whom she believed to be one of his Spain Under-21 team-mates at the time.
results.webTitle: David de Gea named in sexual assault case but denies any involvement
